main

Class DriveManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.DriveManager

  • public class DriveManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The DriveManager Class is responsible for controlling all of the robots movements, such at driving forward, rotating or transforming. It also stores all of the important constants.
    Version:
    Final 1.0.5
    Author:
    Connor Fowlie, David Castonguay, Lucas Bluethner

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void beep6()
      This method cause the robot to beep 6 times, it is used if the robot has to abandon flag search.
      static int convertAngle(double angle)
      Takes in and angle and converts it to a rotational distance.
      static int convertDistance(double distance)
      Converts a distance in cm to motor rotation.
      void forwardBy(double dist)
      This method causes the robot to travel forward by a distance (in cm)
      main.DriveThread getDriveThread()
      Returns the instance of the DriveThread
      static DriveManager getInstance()
      Gets the drive manager instance, this is used to access drive manager and helps prevent more than one instance of the drive manager.
      EV3LargeRegulatedMotor getLeftMotor()
      Returns the instance of leftMotor.
      EV3LargeRegulatedMotor getLeftUpMotor()
      Returns the instance of leftUpMotor.
      EV3LargeRegulatedMotor getRightMotor()
      Returns the instance of rightMotor.
      EV3LargeRegulatedMotor getRightUpMotor()
      Returns the instance of rightUpMotor.
      void lineLocWait()
      This method drives forward until a black line is detected, and used it to straighten out the robots trajectory.
      void setDriveSpd()
      This method sets the wheel motors to a speed suitable for driving in a straight line.
      void setDriveThread(main.DriveThread driveThread)
      Sets to the driveThead given
      void setRotSpd()
      This method sets the wheel motors speed to a slower speed suitable for rotating on point.
      void setSLRotSpd()
      This method sets the wheel motors speed to a slower speed suitable for line localization.
      void start()
      Starts the drive thread.
      double[] startCornerLoc()
      Returns the proper starting corner information.
      void stopAll()
      This method stops the motors controlling the wheels to stop rotating.
      void transform()
      This method cause the robots track to expand or contract depending on what state it is in already.
      void travelTo(double x, double y, boolean avoid)
      This method causes the robot to travel to the absolute field location (x,y), specified in tile points.
      void travelToGrid(double x, double y)
      Travels to the given x and y coordinated by traveling in the x direction first and then Y.
      void turnBy(double theta)
      This method causes the robot to turn (on point) by amount theta.
      void turnTo(double headingT)
      This method causes the robot to turn towards an explicit heading
      static double widthCheck()
      This methods tells us what the current track with is depending on which state the robot is in, transformed state or not.

      • turnBy

        public void turnBy(double theta)
            throws OdometerExceptions
        This method causes the robot to turn (on point) by amount theta.
        Parameters:
        theta - angle to turn by in degrees; positive angle turns clockwise, negative angle turns counter-clockwise
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions
